alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Major; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 8:05PM CDT until July 13 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward, Dewey and Major Counties. For the North Canadian River...including Woodward, Woodward, Seiling, Watonga, El Reno, Yukon, Oklahoma City at NW 10th Street, Oklahoma City at Britton Road, Harrah, Shawnee, Wetumka...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Shallow flooding of lowlands occurs along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. late tonight at 415 AM CDT.
